text:
Using Cygwin, Win32 supports a real (GNU) chmod.  This task should allow (optional element?) Win32 users the ability to indicate that their environment has a real chmod rather than being disabled out of the gate based on the platform itself.

This is a very minor enhancement request.  Simple workaround is to exec chmod.
creator: frotz.faatuai@am.sony.com

text:
It would be really helpful to have Win32 functionality in chmod. The 
Unix 'chmod' command falls somewhere between the Win32 'attrib' and 'cacls' 
commands. I'm sure an intrepid programmer could come up with some reasonable 
mapping between the two OS's, but I'd be satisfied if there was just some way 
to call "attrib -r". What else do people use chmod for?
creator: louisth@hotmail.com
jesse@cryptocard.com
text:
I've attached a tast that handles attrib.exe on Windows. It is based on the
chmod task. I agree that it would be nice to have a cross platform task that
could handle chmod, chown & chgrp on Unix & attrib & cacls on Windows. Such a
task would likely be easier with the VFS in Ant2. In the meantime here is a
simple task that will will handle 'attrib -r', probably the most common operation.

Jesse

Bug 7624 is a more general version of this request.
